episode.title: City of Pittsburgh v. Alco Parking Corporation

section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice Byron R. White

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: The disposition of 73-582, Pittsburgh against Alco Parking Corporation and two companion -- two other cases which are related 72-1490 and 72-1491 FPC against Texaco and Dougherty against Texaco will each be announced by Mr. Justice White.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: The Pittsburgh case comes here from the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
That court invalidated a taxing ordinance in the city of Pittsburgh.
The ordinance placed a special tax on off-street parking transactions.

The Supreme Court of Pennsylvania held that the tax was unduly high and that when combined with some other stiff competition from the city zone parking lots, the tax wasnâ€™t equivalent to an uncompensated confiscation of the property contrary to the Fourteenth Amendment.
We reverse the judgment of the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Under our prior cases, we do not think the city of Pittsburgh exceeded its powers under the Fourteenth Amendment.
Mr. Justice Powell has filed a concurring opinion in this case.
